summary: The document is a confidential communication detailing procedures for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) investigators' interactions with staff personnel during the investigation of President John F. Kennedy's assassination. It emphasizes the necessity of prior notice for contacts, restricts comments to cover capacity work only, and mentions the absence of planned contacts with certain staffers. The document, marked as 'SECRET', is part of the records released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
key_findings: The document is part of the records released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
It details a working agreement with the HSCA regarding investigator contacts with staff personnel.
Instructions are given to restrict comments to work performed in cover capacity if contacted without prior notice.
The document highlights the confidential nature of the communication, marked as 'SECRET'.
